title: WiFi oven?
text:
Great in manual mode, WiFi only works up to 30 feet from the modem/ gateway! I had to buy a range extender, spent hours trying to get it to connect. Spent hours on4 phone calls to Whirlpool. No luck. Called the warrant guys (Solar), they were able to get it working. I‚Äôm pretty tech savvy, but not with WiFi extenders. No the all talk to each other!
The app is straight forward, and works!

title: Remote actions have done issues
text: Even though the app stated that the dryer had remote start enabled, and I had turned it on on the dryer,There was an issue with having to go back and turn the remote enable back on again, and I finally got my first remote start to work. The app does not say if the dryer of in use. I have already created a Whirlpool account and when I click on a link in the app to look at product information and manuals on Whirlpool‚Äòs website it does not recognize my login. I think that there should be a help area of the app that explains each feature or at least have a working link to your webpage with all of the features laid out.I have not tried the washer yet but I‚Äôm already not seeing any options to have the washer control the dryer in terms of the settings needed based on the settings used to wash the clothes.

title: Colossal waist of time.. why??
text:
After reading all the poor reviews of this app I went ahead and decided to give it a try. 
Why did I do this? Well, quite simply because we just paid over one thousand dollars each for a washer and dryer set and I wanted to make sure we were getting all that we paid for.
After I down loaded the app and went through the clunky process of registration then pairing (a lot of UI improvements needed here) I finally got to where I was supposed to connect to my home wireless, this is where I was presented with the ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù screen.. what a rip off!! After paying over a thousand bucks each for the washer and dryer I have to pay a monthly subscription to connect to mobile device! 
No way am I subscribing to this tactic to get more money out of me and you shouldn‚Äôt either. These models are presented as top of the line but require a subscription to access all its features.. NOPE!!

title: Unreliable
text: For one the OS on the washers and dryers touchscreens are slow as molasses and then all the connectivity issues can take longer getting things reconnected and it‚Äôs SSOOOOOO dumb that you need to press a button physically on the machine to be able to remote control. As well it should totally be my option to make the machine just start a cycle again even though it just finished one without needing me to go press the remote control button again it‚Äôs all so silly and then the app just constantly signs out of the account it‚Äôs soooo frustrating makes me want to create another startup to take on big appliances you‚Äôre too rich from these expensive machines to be making such poor quality machines in this modern time.

title: Huh?
text:
... why would I turn on the washer, press remote enable and turn set the washer from my phone?  I should just stay at the washer and do everything from the machine itself because it‚Äôs a waste of time dealing with the glitchy app.  The app losing contact with the machine constantly.  I won‚Äôt be paying for this at all when the free trial is up. It‚Äôs not worth the hassle at all.  

Maybe they will improve the app - by first making it to where you can truly control the washer using the app without the need to first turn the machine on and then press enable ON THE MACHINE!  üëÄ.   I can control my thermost via the ‚ÄúFREE‚Äù app without being at the thermostat to turn it on and then press another button. Same goes for everything else in my house with an app!

title: Less than 6 mos old & not working
text: Our new washer was purchased because our old one was becoming unreliable... and it has been unreliable and now does not work at all. The cycle starts, then ‚Äúfinishes‚Äù happily announcing ‚Äúcycle complete‚Äù within 2-3 minutes. Without having washed a thing. Whirlpools solution was to unplug it then plug it back in again. Which worked the first 15 times this problem occurred. But now doesn‚Äôt work. After an hour on the phone with customer service ... again. We have to wait almost 10 days for a service person to be sent out. That appointment window is 8 hours long. To say we are disappointed not only with our purchase, but the customer service too, is an understatement.

title: Not worth it
text: Bought machine not even 2 years ago and I have had it serviced 3 times. Good thing I bought the extended warranty!!! 1st it was the water inlet valve needed replaced and also the laundry detergent and fabric softener dispenser wasn‚Äôt dispensing fabric softener and dispenser needed replaced. 2nd the machine wasn‚Äôt dispensing fabric softener again and the line was clogged and the line needed cleaned. 3rd the dryer fan malfunctioning needed to replace the whole dryer unit the cause was partly from fabric softener clogged up the fan....so was advised for the convenience of using dispenser need to clean dispenser after every use or use 2 in 1 pods.... uhg I disabled the dispenser and now using pods. Very disappointed in this machine.

I initially thought the app was sleek. At first I could not find where to add a new device. I also had trouble inputting my address. I know my address was correct, it only worked when I disabled wifi & allowed location tracking (annoying/alarming). Why does my washing machine want my location ? After setup I enjoyed using the app. I recommend disabling the requirement to register address in order to use washer & dryers. Overall 7/10.

title: Best use of technology!
text: As someone who easily distracted and end up with a dryer full of wrinkled clothing  I absolutely love getting a text when drying is complete!  My only negative (and this is a tiny thing) but it would be helpful to get a 5 minute ‚Äúheads up‚Äù but other than that I give this a 10 out of 10.

title: Wish I could use it with my Apple Watch
text: I like this app. I just wish that the app was compatible with the Apple Watch. I would rather look at my watch to see that the timer is done then to run to my phone. Plus on the app I wish it would make like a repeating sound because if I don‚Äôt look at my phone I won‚Äôt see the the notifications‚Ä¶ otherwise I do like this app overall.

title: Can‚Äôt create an account
text:
The sign up form doesn‚Äôt work. When on the last page to accept the terms, the button has no effect. (Yes I checked the boxes)
I even tried to create an account on the website. It worked but in the app, when I enter my email, it doesn‚Äôt know that I have an account. And I don‚Äôt know how it could work since the restrictions for creating a new password are different on the app and the website (special characters).

What‚Äôs funny is that if you want to report a bug in the app, you need to be logged in! How ironic! üòÄ

title: Interface Still Glitchy
text:
Washer and Dryer user. Two biggest problems:
1) When a cycle is complete you are forced to follow their workflow (tasks to fold, etc.) but can‚Äôt restart a fresh cycle for a little more drying or an extra rinse.
2) Only one person per household can connect or the app crashes BAD. 
 I‚Äôve been using various iterations for a year. Little changes but no big improvements. I‚Äôd also make sure the start button isn‚Äôt hidden from view while choosing program.

title: WiFi
text: We don‚Äôt have the 2g lower internet choice. So we can‚Äôt take advantage of all the features.

title: Subscription Services For A Washing Machine?!
text: I downloaded the app because I thought it would be cool to have the app since the washer we purchased had the option.  After I found it required a subscription I deleted the app (yes I know about the free trial).  It‚Äôs ridiculous.  I bought a 2k grill with WiFi and that has no subscription for their app.  What can I do on the app that requires a subscription?  Order more soap?  Change the settings of the washing machine?  I guess I‚Äôll be like a caveman and press the buttons on the control instead...

title: Finicky App

title: Washer/Dryer tasks useless

Please fold clothes‚Äù immediately. The app does not wait until the clothes are dry to send the message. This does not seem to be correct. If this is by design, this feature is beyond completely useless.

title: Inconsistent, slow performance

Unfortunately connectivity is spotty and often times when I open the app, it just ‚Äòspins‚Äô forever without actually loading a home page.

We received Whirlpool appliances when we bought a new-build home.  In the 2 years of since we bought the house, we have replaced the control panel on our wall double oven 3 times and are currently waiting on replacement part #4.  It keeps failing.

Prior to this, our microwave was replaced 4 times before Whirlpool bought it back.  We used to the refund to buy a Frigidaire microwave.

title: This app does not work
text: How exactly did this app receive a 4.6 rating?  when all reviews all relates back to the same thing, THIS APP DOES NOT WORK!!! After installing this app and added my appliance and activated it via an email verification which I did with no problem, everything was fine UNTIL relaunching the app a message came up stating that terms and conditions were updated which I agreed to and press (next) in order to continue to operate my appliance‚Ä¶it did not work (are you surprised). No matter how many times I press (next) it went no further. So desperate to make this work I went to the earlier email verification that was sent in the initial setup and tried to do a reconfirm thinking it was glitch, and of course it came back with a message stating that my email address to this account have already been verified. So now I have this app and appliance that does not work with each other. I am not the type of person who feed on the negative and slander people‚Äôs efforts, but I must say what would it have taken to see that the process actually worked for the general person looking to maximize the use of their appliance they spent good money for without the obvious frustration of an app that does not work. I would be stupid to ask if anyone tested this before release but,‚Ä¶did anyone tested this before release? And based on the complaints did anyone even bothered to fix these issues or did you just see all the bad reviews and say ‚Äúoh well it‚Äôs not our problem anymore ‚Äú as I am sure based on the issues you should be able to pinpoint and fix this problem. It is unfair to the consumer to be led to think that the extra coins spent on a particular item would give them an advantage only to find out it would have been better to save those coins and get the regular stuff as this smartphone communication is nothing more than a marketing gimmick geared only to fleece the unsuspecting customer into thinking they have upgraded. Seriously you all need to do your job and deliver a product that actually works and stop delivering needless aggregation to customers.

title: Please bring the old app back
text: A week before the new version of the app was released, I was about the write a very positive review (4 stars), commending the app improving its quality and stability with kitchen appliances after several years of the opposite. The old version let you see each kitchen appliance and within one screen see the status and tap to toggle options like oven light, vent fan, etc. When cooking was done, you would get a push notification on your device with an option to stop cooking, keep the temp and continue cooking or set it to keep warm. Then the real powerful, under the radar feature was you could set up multi step cooking- broil for x minutes, then bake for y minutes, and keep warm for z minutes. This was awesome. Now in the new version all of that is nowhere to be found and I feel like whirlpool literally cheated me since I paid for my appliances expecting those feature to be available. It‚Äôs fine to pretty things up and modernize looks once and while but please don‚Äôt do it at the expense of what makes something useful.

title: Could be so much more
text:
The app functions fine, but there are so many more things the developers could do. There are too many steps to remotely control an appliance and also too many restrictions. Wish I could start my dishwasher from any where at any time. Not keep pressing the remote button each time it is opened. Same with the microwave. Good ideas, but need to really start catching up with the remote control ideas in this generation if they want to remain relevant. Expected more.

Update: Moved to 4 star as I reinstalled the app and fixed some of the issues. I appreciate the company reaching out. Good customer service.

Still have to select remote control each time which is redundant and cumbersome, but I am liking my appliances more and more, each and everyday. Just bought a dryer as well. Now I have the smart dishwasher, microwave, and dryer. Looking forward to what updates software updates could bring.

title: Really disappointed
text:
This app is nearly useless for the set of wall ovens we have. Just found out my oven was on all night though the display on the oven vaguely indicated it was off (there‚Äôs no confirmation that is off you just have to guess). They brought the guessing game into the app as well, there‚Äôs no status indicator telling you the oven is on or off, it just says ‚Äúready to cook‚Äù. One oven is on, the other off but they both show the same text. The app has this huge useless slide up thing that has static links to different blog posts on their site which would be fine if it didn‚Äôt make you think it was there to control the appliance.

In addition, the remote start constantly disconnects, I have to reenable it on the oven(s) every few days. This problem also cascades to Alexa, which makes this feature useless since you can‚Äôt actually remote start.

Finally I get to the controls for the oven(s), when you go to an appliance they‚Äôve wasted the entire screen with a picture of an oven and give you one small terse button under something called ‚Äúshortcuts‚Äù that says ‚Äúsee all oven features‚Äù. Just list them in all that extra space you used to show me what a oven looks like. 

Emphasis on their blog, nonexistent status indicators, and a lot of places to add appliances but not control them makes you think they don‚Äôt actually want you to control the appliance from it.

title: Slow Go, But Working Well Now!!
text: I Purchased a Whirlpool WEG750H0HZ smart range in July of 2018. I was really frustrated at first because, although I could use the range as a conventional stove/oven, none of the advertised ‚Äúsmart‚Äù functions were at all reliable. However, in late November, early December, things got a lot better. Yummly support now functions as it should as does controlling the unit with Amazon‚Äôs Alexa. I am glad I stuck it out and kept the the range. Best appliance purchase I‚Äôve made in a long time.

title: Can‚Äôt even log in
text: I use a password manager and the app wouldn‚Äôt let me paste a password into the ‚Äúnew password‚Äù box. So I used a desktop web browser to create an account, but my password failed the validation even though it met all stated criteria (it exceeded the required length, contained upper and lower case letters, a digit, and two special characters not on the exclusion list). Eventually I figured out that the problem was that the special characters chosen by my password manager weren‚Äôt allowed, even though they weren‚Äôt on the exclusion list on the web site. Having successfully registered using a desktop browser, I returned to the app and discovered that it wouldn‚Äôt let me log in with that password. I kept truncating my password in case it was just too long for the app but had no success, even after I changed it to the stupid ‚ÄúPassword1!‚Äù (stupid but apparently valid on the web site). I can‚Äôt believe a user experience can even be this bad in 2019. Whirlpool should be embarrassed to have released this.

title: Great WLab oven poor appl
text:
It takes to long to look inside plus on some chicken settings you can‚Äôt set what temp you want the meat to heat

Lastly if you cook TV dinners don‚Äôt get the oven. Come on Whirlpool you can‚Äôt use scan with this appliance to let the oven know how to properly heat the TV dinner or any pre made dishes. Poor poor poor

After the latest update I can‚Äôt even look inside garbage!!!  I only have one device and it keeps saying that I have to use the original device that I used to setup the app. I only have the one garbage. 

Plus forget customer support as your speaking to someone with an Indian accent who does not understand the product

I recommend that you stay away from Whirlpool and their uncaring company

Update I called again and got someone from the USA. He admitted that three other callers had the same issue as I did. He forwarded the information to the engineering team. 

I will follow up if this gets resolved

Follow up no phone call back from Whirlpool even thou their smart oven and app is buggy

The only advice I got is to clean the lens cover. That did not work 

So far I am disappointed in this product. Until Whirlpool fixes their bugs stay away from their so called smart ovens.

title: Piece of crap
text: Not only does this app have a slew of bugs with first connecting your products, after you take an hour to get them connected you have to deal with the bugs of dryers and washers constantly saying ‚Äúidle‚Äù, and not responding to commands from the app or sending updates...they just sit at  ‚Äúidle‚Äù. Once you attempt to call whirlpool to get assistance you are placed on hole for twelve minutes and then get sent to a voicemail box where you leave a message only to never receive a call back. The range does the same thing with sitting on idle on the app.  Brand new out of the box, it doesn‚Äôt get hot and the oven light does not work. The app and appliances have been nothing but problems since the start.  I regret spending the significant amount of money for the supposed ‚Äúlatest and greatest‚Äù from Whirlpool...formerly my most trusted brand.  Big fail, Whirlpool...y‚Äôall need to get it together before you lose all of your lifelong customers.

title: Missing Major Features
text:
I don‚Äôt honestly understand what this app could be useful for since it‚Äôs missing the only two features I would want. I can‚Äôt start my dryer unless I physically go to the machine and push ‚Äúremote enabled‚Äù each time at which point I just use the button on the machine is self. It saves me zero time. 
The app could redeem itself if only I could add time to an existing cycle but I can‚Äôt even do that. 
The only function that‚Äôs moderately useful is that it tells me when the dryer is finished, so I can immediately go restart it for an additional 15 minutes because my clothes are never dry from a single cycle. 
The app is also a trial period and apparently costs money after that trial. I wouldn‚Äôt pay $0.01 for this app in fact I will probably delete it far before my trial period ends.

title: The App is Crap
text:
Do not waste your time with Whirlpool ‚Äûsmart‚Äú appliances. Love he Whirlpool products from a reliability standpoint, but a digital company they are not. Good old mechanical engineering is what they are good at and make a reliable product but the digital age will leave them behind if this generation of smart appliances and app are their answer to it. 

Have a washer and dryer pair that took forever to get connected till it finally worked. Now, despite the pair working and sending text messages (that are correct), the status in the app never changes. The dryer is permanently in ‚ÄûIdle‚Äú despite an Text telling me that my clothes are dry. And a washer that constantly shows 41 minutes left in the cycle. Device resets (full power off) and app reinstall does not correct the problem. 

Washer-Dryer pair good.... smart Features, remedial at best... to be fair they are super ‚Äödumb‚Äò and serve no real purpose .... the App, well, like i said .... CRAP

title: Disappointed
text:
We paid more for the fancy appliances you could operate with this app. Upon trying initial setup I waited on hold with customer support for 45 minutes only to be met with an employee who seemed annoyed I called to bother him. Got enough info from him that finally got things to work. The app itself reads in Centigrade. We cannot find how to change to Fahrenheit so if I want to use the app to turn oven on I first have to convert my temps. Quicker to go to the oven and just turn the darn thing on. We emailed customer support to ask about this and days later got a response to call to ask instead. Yeah, another long wait for grumpy support people? No thanks. There‚Äôs a huge lag in app telling me a timer is done so I cannot rely on that and just use a secondary alarm on my phone.

If you could simply tell me how to change temp in app to Fahrenheit I‚Äôd be a happier customer.

title: Whirlpool let down
text:
A complete let down in every facet, I understand a pandemic is on going but 6 months for our range to finally arrive , downloaded the app for all our brand new matching appliances and nothing will connect . The app shows a blank white screen with only the + sign in upper corner and I cannot access anything. Spent the extra money to have the WiFi features and I can‚Äôt even use them , what‚Äôs the point? The screen on the microwave is glitching and you can‚Äôt scroll , the fridge came with the wrong doors on it ( you could look into the fridge with doors closed) the tracks for the range door are loose and it sags . Can‚Äôt wait for more time to pass to see what else is wrong ( sarcasm ) range WEE750HOHZ1
Microwave WMHA9019HZ-3 , fridge WRF757SDHZ02. DO NOT PURCHASE

title: They Charge You!
text:
I have waited to buy a new washer and dryer for one with WiFi. I don‚Äôt want anything special just a message to tell me when it‚Äôs done.  I waited specifically for Whirlpool to get it as that‚Äôs the brand I wanted to be loyal to. 

I bought the new washer and dryer and now I have to pay them 12 bucks a year for a poorly written app to get that message? What a waste. I‚Äôll go back to setting my timer and my smart washer is now dumb.

‚ÄúDear Developer‚Äù Thanks for the response. Obviously I tried the free version,  but you give me 6 months to try the service. I don‚Äôt plan to own this appliance for 6 months. I would like the feature I thought it came with to be a part of that. You have confirmed it‚Äôs not. And my review stands.. You charge us for a bad app..

title: New interface/missing watch app
text:
We literally just received our washer/dryer a few days ago. I was not super impressed with the app but it was functional. The watch app was one of the reasons we were excited about the connected features, to receive notifications on the watch was huge!  We do NOT have Alexa or Google devices in our home, but we have Apple products. 

A few days after getting everything going and the app was updated. Not for the better, it is slow to launch, and navigate to appliances. The watch app is now gone.  It appears to be more of an advertisement then utility. Functions the were a few clicks away are now several clicks away, which is not an improvement. Adding nice photography does not improve the user experience. 

Also, when logged into the app it still requires a logging to access account features like privacy feature. Again, not user friendly design.  

I can only hope the app become more useful. Currently, it does not promote the use of connected appliances.

title: Whirlpool = we all got fool
text: Is nice to buy some nice appliances for your home like one of the named brand Whirlpool that people love. But when it comes to new technology they are simply not ready for it. With all the build in WiFi touch screen and etc features you can‚Äôt simply turn off the hood fan when is overheated. Yes it is a safety feature but don‚Äôt we get to decide if we want it off or not? Having to unplug the unit if you need to leave in a hurry and reset everything later is time consuming. It supposed to be more efficient not a burden? Btw calling the customer service only make it worst, long waiting and non useful advice. And guess what is too late to return it now. Perhaps is less stress cooking with a camping stove on the dining table than expensive set of whirlpool.

title: I‚Äôm tech savvy but this app is ridiculous
text: I consider myself to be a tech savvy person. I stick with it until I solve it. But this app is an absolute mess. The oven is connected to the internet, my router shows the IP address and Mac id as an user and still this app won‚Äôt work. I continuously get the message it can‚Äôt connect to a router. I went out and bought a new router, nothing. I checked all the info and it‚Äôs remote enabled. Nothing out on the net, that I can find, to help. I‚Äôve unplugged and plugged in the stove which is an absolute pain. Customer service isn‚Äôt in. I‚Äôve spent a week trying to troubleshoot and nothing changes. I‚Äôm beyond frustrated. If you‚Äôre going to make a stove cost $2000 for the bells and whistles then make sure the bells and whistles work!! Ready to take it back.

title: Needs a lot of work
text:
Crashes or requires a lot of work on my iphone 8S and my wife‚Äôs iphone 7. Nothing wrong with my internet connection, router or other smart devices on my end, this is a software issue.
Doesn‚Äôt update information. For instance if I checked on the oven timer status last night and tried access controls it won‚Äôt let me do it using the app unless I reset it. Just like last night it doesn‚Äôt let me see changes unless I reboot. It would be nice if the program were robust, it seems like a fragile development version. Some functionality isn‚Äôt there until I reboot on my iphone. It would be better if easy to use and didn‚Äôt require so many reboots.

title: Appliance will not connect to WiFi
text: The software for our wall oven is very glitchy. We think it just needs an update, but we cannot get the appliance to connect to our WiFi network. We followed the instructions on the mobile app, but it assumes that the appliance connects to the WiFi router at a certain step in the process but the appliance never actually connects.  So, we have to call during business hours to speak with a technician, which means one of has to take time off from work just to get our stupid oven connected. It should not be this difficult to connect an appliance. The oven is at least useable without connecting to the internet, it‚Äôs just glitchy as hell.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work
text: App is more or less useless. It always says it‚Äôs in some state that it‚Äôs actually not. It will say idle when it‚Äôs cooking, that instructions were sent when none were. It takes opening and closing the app multiple times, restarting the app, enabling/disabling settings to get it synced up correctly, and even then it still doesn‚Äôt work. Remote control is always disabled in the app even when it‚Äôs enabled on the microwave, so it‚Äôs useless. Only thing that seems to work somewhat consistently are the push notifications that the microwave completed, which really isn‚Äôt useful anyway since you can‚Äôt start it remotely and the microwave done sound is loud enough to be heard throughout the house.

title: Works great!
text: I almost didn‚Äôt buy this microwave because  of the negative reviews here. Maybe it‚Äôs because of the app update that just came out or maybe it‚Äôs because I‚Äôm not trying to use it on two phones, but so far it works great! I‚Äôve remotely controlled my microwave from the phone and love the push notifications when a timer goes off or the microwave is done heating the food! It‚Äôs so convenient when you‚Äôre in another room!

title: Never great and getting worse
text:
As others mentioned, having to activate Remote on the appliance each and every time is a time waster ‚Äî seems like we should be able to choose the default. 

Beyond that, still many bugs. Despite checking ‚ÄúStay Logged In‚Äù the app bounces me out every week to 10 days or so. One of our appliances will randomly lose connection with the WiFi while the other continues. 

The biggest disappointment has been the ‚Äúintegration‚Äù with Google Assistant. Our daughter is blind, so we thought this would make it very easy for her to choose the cycle on the washer, etc. Unfortunately, all you can do is start the washer or check the time left ‚Äî everything else is through the app.
___________
UPDATE: These issues are getting worse the more time that goes by. I‚Äôve emailed and they say ignore it, or say call Customer Service. That is open M-F 8-5, when I‚Äôm at work, so I can‚Äôt be I front of the appliance.

title: OMG
text:
This app does not work period. Ive been in the electronics industry for 28 years, & after troubleshooting for over 2 hours, Im convinced this app or the communication with oven/ network does not work. I have Reset oven to factory setting, Downloaded & erased this app, rebooted my phone, rebooted all my network gear, several times during my very frustrating time with this app, & oven. Quit rushing products and or apps to market without making them work. Unfortunately I am well aware of the fact that things aren‚Äôt always as they seem in the electronics market, but disappointed none the less. Oven is connected to network but is not useable through app. 
Thanks for this Hour Of my life I‚Äôll never get back

title: Worthless app
text:
I called for a service warranty issue on my range and the recording immediately promoted this app as being a way to create a service warranty appointment.  

I downloaded the app, installed the app, registered  the app, signed in, and the only thing I could do was add an appliance!  

My appliance, a double oven range, could not be added because it is NOT a smart appliance. Therefore I could not do anything in this app, and for all I could see, even if I could register my product, there was no way to request warranty service!!!!  (the ceramic coating on the inside of the oven flaking off, after 2nd cleaning).  

Also annoying, Whirlpool‚Äôs 1950‚Äôs designed call center phone tree software could also benefit redesign for 2020.  

Totally opaque, simply, it offers no idea of the length of hold time, and calling in, randomly may offer a call back from an available rep, but if you choose to wait, good luck, your stuck waiting.  You have a better chance of getting through to a DMV operator!!!!!

title: Worst app. Worst dryer ever.
text: Purchased the tier dryer. Would never stop drying. Ran for hours. Changed sensors. Changed machine. Same problem. Demanded supplier change out to a new model. Upgraded to a new machine, literally most expensive that they make. Everything digital control. So difficult. User interface the worst. App is the worst. Won‚Äôt work without I putting all of your personal info location etc. Won‚Äôt work without location settings on. Machine refuses to connect to WiFi‚Äôs. The app which is supposed to make it easy does not. Have to manual setup and even then won‚Äôt work. I would throw this out if I had another $3000 to spend on washer dryer.

title: Terrible setup experience
text:
The app makes you confirm your email address but the emails are already expired when they are delivered!  Took about 10 min for the emails to arrive, opened immediately and get message ‚Äúconfirmation expired‚Äù.  TERRIBLE first impression, trying to set up the app for  $3300 appliance.  Whirlpool quality is very poor!

Edit: got an email response from Whirlpool today, offering to review.  So that‚Äôs good.  I was able to verify my email after the 7th attempt.  But it took way too long and too much frustration, really dampening the first impression of the appliance.  Whirlpool: how about expiring the verification email after 30 min instead of 5.

title: Last update broke my app
text:
The app is so slow it‚Äôs completely useless. Every click including signing  in with Touch ID results in 2 minutes of a spinning icon before moving to the next step only to do it again with every click. 

I could walk to the over from a mile away and start it faster than trying to use the app remote features from my couch. You can‚Äôt even get the  ‚ÄúApp Support‚Äù link here correct. It  takes you to the Whirlpool website and has nothing to do at all with the app! Everything is completely useless including the identical copy/paste response you reply to every comment with

title: Changed my mind
text:
I didnt discover my oven‚Äôs app control until after it was purchased. I scoffed when I read the manual; ‚ÄúWHUT?!? Who the heck needs THAT capability!‚Äù

Six months later, Im delighted by it.

My only disappointment is occasionally finding a food that doesn't subscribe to scan-to-cook, but its not a deal breaker; Ive already got my phone in hand and oven setup is just a few taps away.

If I can make one teeny recommendation; make it so the app remembers the present time/temp/delay settings. Sometimes, I‚Äôll make a mistake and, when reentering the setting, you've gotta roll through the whole wheel again, from minimum.

Good Job Whirlpool, I love this capability.

title: Smart features don't really work
text: I like so many others paid extra for the smart version of the whirlpool washer and dryer. The experience has been frustrating and a waste of time and money.  Support for the smart features is non-existent unless you happen to get transferred to the secret department that knows a little bit. Also - I've already had two hardware problems and parts replaced on the dryer. Washer seems to disconnect from wifi occasionally so I'm sure it will need parts soon. And the app needs work. Notifications on only one device?  What were the developers thinking?  Smart features are a marketing gimmick at this point. Don't pay extra for them...

title: new appliance - worked until appliance downloaded update
text: Just got a new microwave yesterday and was intrigued by the ‚Äòsmart‚Äô capability. loaded it up and got it connected. later in the day, I saw that it was downloading a software update. following the software update, the connection was lost and no longer would it make a connection. Appears to see the home wifi, but just spins its wheels until it gives up and quits. Good idea while it lasted. I just hope the appliance is a better quality than its wifi capability, otherwise Lowe‚Äôs gets it back.

title: Works ok on iPhone not on watch
text: It took me bit to get my iPhone to finally recognize the oven, but after a while it finally did and I have been using it no problems since November.  I got a watch for Xmas and was excited to see the app was available on my watch so I tried to use it...no dice. It doesn‚Äôt give me any options at all, it just says no appliances detected. I looked for information online but can‚Äôt find anything related. Will try to contact Whirlpool support tomorrow and may change my review based on response from them.

title: Useless Garbage
text:
App will tell you multiple times that it connected the appliance successfully, only to go to an Idle state, and then 5-10 minutes later to Offline state. The range itself will not remember the network and it keeps acting like it‚Äôs never connected to a network before, even after it has successfully connected with strong signal. Instructions for setup can be unclear for those who are not tech savvy. If I had know the whirlpool smart appliances were this dumb, I would have bought Samsung or something else.

TL;DR: don‚Äôt waste your time with this app and if you haven‚Äôt bought appliances yet, don‚Äôt buy Whirlpool ‚Äúsmart‚Äù appliances.

title: Up and running after a few false starts
text:
My microwave/oven combo somehow was pushed an update overnight and low and behold I was able to set up my account and get everything working this morning. I was prompted to call to disconnect the appliances from the previous owner‚Äôs account. This whole process took 15 min. Very pleased. Looking forward to seeing what I can do. 

Mostly I‚Äôm very grateful to your dev team for pushing the bug fix that would not let me scroll on the microwave/oven combo‚Äôs screen!!

Previous review-
I‚Äôve tried 5 times over 3 days and still can‚Äôt set up an account. Without an account I can‚Äôt pair my appliances with the app. I‚Äôm looking forward to this being fixed and being able to do more with what‚Äôs in my home.

title: Terrible app
text:
I decided to spend an extra $125 on a Whirlpool smart microwave over a competitive model without smart features. This extra money spent has been an entire waste.

Long story but I‚Äôve had two of these smart microwaves (installer messed up original install) and each time it took me over an hour to figure out how to connect the microwave to the app.  This should not happen. The app is half baked. The setup walk-through wizard never sets the microwave up to my home network.  I could never set the microwave up using the app; I eventually figured out how to add through WPS. 

The app also offers the ability to automatically set the time based on the time on your iPhone....well even this feature spots working occasionally and the clock on the microwave just stops keeping time. 

The microwave frequently goes offline in the app when the Whirlpool servers are down. 

All of this for what?

title: Cannot even log in
text: I tried to create an account a month ago when our new double wall oven was installed. The app kept telling me the passwords did not match. I gave up due to the chaos of my kitchen remodel. However, I have still received notifications when preheat is complete as well as when my timer is done. I just tried again, it won‚Äôt let me log in. I tried to reset my password and after using 2 strong passwords suggest by my iPhone and my own password, I was still denied access. It told me the passwords did not match. I‚Äôm disappointed in this poor quality app for the most expensive appliance in my kitchen.

title: Can‚Äôt connect app w my range
text:
I‚Äôm sad to say I have tried connecting my app with my range and it doesn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôve tried ez connect, WPS, and even manually connecting my range to the WiFi. The range connects, but each time the app doesn‚Äôt seem to recognize that the oven connected properly. I haven‚Äôt been able to use the WiFi feature of my new range because of this app.

*UPDATE: Even after the recent app updates, the app still doesn‚Äôt recognize that my range is connected. The app will get the range to connect, but then it keeps trying to connect the range even though the range successfully connected to my WiFi.

title: Full of bugs
text:
First of all This app is full of bugs. It doesn‚Äôt show me any option/ functionality to start my appliance (oven) remotely. Also every time you open the app it pops up a message saying the terms were updated and then you click next to accept and nothing happens. I opened a bug report and after a month I received a response that I should contact customer support by phone (really?? So why you have a bug report tool!?)
I tried removing and reinstalling as well as creating new account but still facing same issues

title: Frustrating to say the least!
text:
I have uninstalled and reinstalled this app three times to fix the login issue, this time I can‚Äôt get back logged in. 

I was able to get the range and app connected on my first try and all was good... then, after about a week it asked me for my login info again. I put in the user if and password I created the account with to no avail! I uninstalled the app, no luck. Reset password and reinstalled the app and got it to work. This happened two more times but now I can‚Äôt get it to recognize the user ID and password I literally just changed! This is so darn frustrating!

title: Can‚Äôt Login
text: I created my new account via app.  Have tried to login repeatedly.  Have reset password repeatedly.  Password fits all criteria and I still can‚Äôt login.  According to the repairman, I need to update software on oven.  If it‚Äôs so critical to update the software, you need to create an app that will let you login and actually work.

title: Love the app but don‚Äôt get notifications w/ iOS 14
text: I love using the app and was excited about the notifications part cause I forgot sometimes about the laundry. But after installing it it does have any notifications settings. I check the app settings and my phone settings... nothing. My boyfriend get them on his phone but he is still on iOS 13.

title: Redesign needs to go back to the drawing board
text:
The new design makes it much harder to control my oven. I now have to scroll through several screens for basic functionality.  

Home > oven > a redundant screen that just has see all oven features > manual > bake > and now I can set a temperature like I used to be able to do from the main screen.  

I wouldn‚Äôt use the app at all but they don‚Äôt support HomeKit and must not expose the api because nobody has a home bridge plugin. This could be a limitation of HomeKit I haven‚Äôt looked to see if it supports ovens or not.

title: Works as advertised
text: Controls appliances. I use it to control my dishwasher. It has all the features I‚Äôd expect to do this basic function. Throughout this app‚Äôs history there have been times when it has been buggy which is why I knocked a star off but right now it seems ok.

title: Complete crap
text: Not only does the ‚Äúsmart‚Äù microwave require a reboot once a month or so because the software is horrible and locks up but the whirlpool app is so poorly  made with so many bugs you spend more time getting it to work than it would take to cook your food.  The scan to cook feature is garbage, scanned over 50 items so far and the app says none are supported. We‚Äôre talking name brand frozen microwave foods like pizzas etc.  complete garbage and waste of money.  Don‚Äôt buy or use any smart whirlpool appliance or app.  I think they are made by high school interns

title: Useless
text:
I wouldn‚Äôt have splurged for a ‚ÄúSmart Oven‚Äù had I known that it was actually going to be so dumb. Whirlpool should offer customers compensation for this poor excuse of a mobile cooking experience. The app simply does nothing. It‚Äôs buggy, shuts off all the time, and most of the advertised appliance features don‚Äôt work.

Try setting a bake from your phone, nope.
Try scanning food item‚Äôs QR or Barcode to cook, nope.
Try adding appliance, and then try it again, and then again. Once you finally get everything set up, the app will then short circuit and fail to perform.

title: Waste of $$$
text: We experienced the same as the other lady. Only the dryer would send notifications though. Both say offline constantly.  I wish they had a lan connection, I would hard wire them. I removed and added them back, on the app and the network, no change. My wifi uses WPA2. I did not change that setting because I would have to change settings on all wifi devices. I have nearly 20 devices on my network at all times, more when company is here. This app and whirlpool smart appliance is a big disappointment.

title: This Dec 2020 app release is terrible!
text:
The previous versions of the Whirlpool app worked fine. They had several useful options I actually used for my oven. Options like ‚ÄúConvect Broil‚Äù etc. 
After updating to this latest release it‚Äôs a pretty face with zero utility. 
I am annoyed at how useless and regressive it is. What happened to all the previous features and functions????
Technology is supposed to improve or lives. What‚Äôs the point of releasing an app that basically makes using your appliance more laborious???

title: Junk
text: Brand new wall oven. Setup Wi-Fi, first off the touchscreen works when it wants to. Second I can remotely turn on the light!!  Yay. But that‚Äôs it. I can‚Äôt set the oven on the app. I keep getting ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt set the appliance unless it‚Äôs enabled‚Äù. It is enabled on both the app and the oven. I‚Äôve rebooted the oven and my phone no less than 6 times and every time I have to reinstall everything on the appliance. Still can‚Äôt set it. But I‚Äôll be darned if I can turn the light on. Whoopy doo. I‚Äôm so far not happy with this appliance and it‚Äôs brand new.

title: Just one big BUG
text: Gave it a single star because zero wasn‚Äôt an option. This app has more bugs than features. Hopefully Whirlpool didn‚Äôt pay this developer much.  You can use the app to turn the light on and off but that is about it. Can‚Äôt change temperature, timer or anything you choose within the app...simply ignores you. The app itself is unappealing and boring...although it is an oven so that‚Äôs probably why. If I could simply change the temperature and time that would be awesome, just those two things.

title: Can‚Äôt even get in
text:
I downloaded this to connect my oven. 

I signed up for an account, but after minutes of waiting it told me the request failed. So I tried again, but it said my email was already in use. 

So I tried logging in with the email I used to create the account, but it says incorrect password. So I click ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù (which is a rude assumption link description; a better phrase would be simple ‚Äúreset password‚Äù), then I reset the password, and tried to log in again. 

It says incorrect password. 

So I go to whirlpool‚Äôs website, and try to log in. It says incorrect password. So I clock ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù again, and pop in my email. It says ‚Äúplease enter a valid email.‚Äù 

This whole experience has been garbage. 

Get your stuff together, Whirlpool.

title: Slow
text: I got a washer and dryer and I love the idea of the app but it takes forever to load the app then forever to load my appliances to see what they are doing, how long is left or just to program them. It just sits there saying loading most of the time. This keeps up and I will definitely be deleting this junk of an app. I have an iPhone X and great WiFi in my house so that definitely isn‚Äôt the issue.

title: 1 hour of my time I wish I had back
text:
I am up computer geek so I was excited when my Whirlpool washer and dryer came with an app. It took me approximately an hour to get through the directions and connect the washer and dryer to my Wi-fi and get the system registered. I was disappointed to find out that the app does pretty much nothing. 

The app appears to be incomplete. The dryer has a photo icon of the unit, but the washer has no icon so the blank space where the image should be makes the side-by-side display look funny.

I was hoping I could start and pause the units by remote control but that function appears to be gray out and I found no way to enable it. So I guess I'm relegated to email alerts when a cycle is done or something is not working correctly.

Hopefully this is a beta and a better update is coming soon

title: Excellent stove, app needs work
text: This is an excellent stove however the whirlpool app has some major issues.  I have not yet found a single scannable item. It would be much more useful if it asked to enter in the information from the package.  Also, even though my stove defaults to Fahrenheit the app defaults to Celsius. This has an obvious disadvantage as you need to spend time converting.  There does not appear to be an option to change and it does not use my iOS defaults.

title: Remote Control Function Issue
text: When Trying to wirelessly start my oven it says you have to have the remote enabled, which only appears to work if you press it on the oven itself, therefore, defeating the purpose of the wireless function. When going into preferences under my oven in the app and turning on this feature it gives you an error message when trying to save that preference. Please advise.

title: Not overjoyed
text:
When the app is working, it‚Äôs okay. I had trouble getting the app to perform the initial sync with my appliance. Now it seems I have to shut the app down before I can get an accurate status of my appliance. Yesterday I couldn‚Äôt turn on my oven but today I can. 

My pet peeve about this app other than the bugs noted above is the app has no capability to turn off your ovens once you turn them on. That is a function that should be added to the app.

title: Repeatedly losses connection and limited ability for family use
text: So disappointed... I have a washer and dryer that I bought for the ‚Äúsmart‚Äù connection. The app has never worked well. First basic issue... The appliances repeatedly lose connection and I have to go through the full setup procedure routinely to reconnect.  Second basic issue... The app will only allow one device in the household to connect unless you enable Family Sharing. With these basic limitations, I would not recommend.

title: New update works fine
text:
Previous App version is just like instructions booklet..

New updated App version had improved a lot with clear images and selection process.. 

Thanks for the update whirlpool..

title: Was working fine... till about a week ago
text: We bought this washer and dryer because we liked the idea of getting notifications when the wash was finished. It worked fine for a few months. Then about a week ago the notifications stopped working. Attempted to remove and re-add appliances to app, and now can't get appliances back on app. Have searched everywhere online for a way to fix. No luck. Going to call Whirlpool service out. If that doesn't work, these appliances are going back.

title: Very frustrating app
text: It has potential, but my wall oven and app are totally missing something as basic as an off button.   I had to reset the software on my oven tonight after cooking dinner because there was no way to just turn it off.  Confusing, terrible app with a lot of potential.  Just give me an off button.   Oven is finally off, but the app is trying to force it back on.  Good concept, I like to be able to preheat from afar, but clunky garbage.

title: Please update this app!
text: 2 years of crap reviews and quite frankly I don‚Äôt think Whirlpool cares. They probably didn‚Äôt even develop the app. I can‚Äôt get my microwave to connect. Tried calling and the hours of the business is crap too. Who expects someone to be standing in front of their unit during the hours when the customer works too. When you have time to help me.... please get up with me. I‚Äôm not chasing you down anymore. I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll be able to reply here as you‚Äôve done everyone else.

title: Update?
text: When are you releasing an update? We paid $1300 for a smart oven a month ago and the app won‚Äôt allow us to control it due to errors with your app. Time to fix this and help your customers move forward.

title: Could be more useful
text: I use the app for my washer, it‚Äôs nice to look and see if the wash cycle is over, but every time I go on the app I have to put my password in. Just keep me signed in please. Mainly, I wish there were an option to have an alarm go off through the app when the cycle is complete or there is an issue with the machine

title: New app breaks push notifications
text:
Update: push notifications are working now after removing my appliances from the app and starting all over again. If you set up your appliances with the old Whirlpool app and notifications aren't working, try that.

Latest version claims to bring bug fixes but the most egregious bug remains ‚Äî push notifications are still 100% non-functional on my Duet washer and dryer with this new app. I have push notifications enabled for the app, but they never arrive.

title: On-line doesn‚Äôt work
text:
Bought a new wall oven and was sold the ability to preheat oven via mobile app. One small detail it doesn‚Äôt work. First I couldn‚Äôt ‚Äúconnect‚Äù to the applicable so wait on hold for 45mins. Finally able to connect.  However the preheat functionality doesn‚Äôt work. Rep says it‚Äôs a major problem and the need to ‚Äúpush‚Äù and update to everyone. 

I‚Äôd like my money back. This is crap and the oven runs hot. Don‚Äôt fall for these crappy appliances and the service team and waits are terrible

title: The worst
text:
Got new stove. Got it connected but it will not connect through app. Stove says it connected to my smart device but the app just gives an error message. After trying about 15 times I got the app through the 1st two stages and then got hung up on security. Tried it again and can‚Äôt even get through the 1st stage. 
So frustrated!! Called twice, they have a service ticket and after 4 days still haven‚Äôt assigned it to a tech. Going to wait til next week and the stove is going back. 
The worst

title: Worked once (update)
text:
Update:
Turned out the app forgot my password and locked me out.  Discovered this by trying to log in from another device, instead of ‚Äútry again‚Äù it said device locked  upgraded to 3*

Signed up, connected to the oven, updated oven firmware, has not allowed me to sign in to app since.  ‚ÄúTry again later‚Äù. Could starve to death with this app!

title: App is unreliable
text: I have tried to use this app for 3 years.  It is very unreliable.  However, I love the appliances!  I even worked for Whirlpool, so I am aware what quality and care goes into making each appliance.  I am very disappointed with the technology developments.  Whirlpool will be left far behind with technology if they don‚Äôt start stepping up their game.  Don‚Äôt use the app, I have tried and I now have 3 different usernames and passwords and it still doesn‚Äôt remember me or what appliances I have purchased.

title: Just terrible!
text: The previous Whirlpool app (white w/the primary colors)  that is still showing up on my macbook and  iPad works great.  It still shows all my connected appliances and their current statuses.  Got new iPhone 6s, was having issues and was instructed to uninstall/reinstall the app, however,  the app  I had is no longer available for downloading, only this one! I t's awful! It shows my dryer but will not show status!  I've deleted/re-added it multiple times! Still nothing.

title: Terrible Experience
text:
This app and their backend web services are so terribly broken, I can‚Äôt even successfully make an account and log in to it.

Password has been created that follows all rules, and is accepted by their web services. Then... it doesn‚Äôt work at login.

Fine, reset the password in the app and enter a new one via the email that comes to my inbox. Success, they say!

False. Still says incorrect password when trying to log in, no matter how many times I change it, how many times I reset it, or how many times I perfectly type in what I know to be flawlessly accurate.

Unusable. No, literally. Their web services issues will not let me even login to the app to utilize my new stove‚Äôs features.

title: Why the fees???
text: I already paid for your expensive appliances which you sold under the guise of being able to remote control them. If you have to charge me monthly (per machine?!?!) for the ability to remote control MY machines, you are guilty of false advertising. The fees should be disclosed up front! But in all realty, there should be no fees in order to use this! The fees are built in to the huge cost of each appliance itself!

title: Easy from the app
text: The oven is easier to control from the app, but it makes it harder by doing it Manuel. They need to adjust that also it sits on keeping it warm & you need to press it a few times until the oven gets turn off.

title: Unreliable and potentially Dangerous
text: Can‚Äôt trust this app.  I connected it to my wall micro/oven.  It took some time through WiFi, and finally came up on the app.  This app will randomly read my oven on broil at 550 degrees, imagine my surprise waking up in the morning thinking the oven had been switched on to broil for the entire night, but it was a false reading.  What if it glitches and it does activate the oven... also their integration with Alexa functionality is terrible.

title: App will not connect
text: This app just will not connect. The microwave connects fine to the network and the app continually says either that there was an error or tries to set it up as if it‚Äôs not already connected. I even tried reinstalling the app with no luck. Now all there is to do is standby for the canned response from the developer sympathizing with my frustration and telling me to call customer service M - F from 8am to 8am... (which judging from the other reviews is also a negative experience)

title: Wish i could give it zero stars
text: It simply doesn‚Äôt work. Almost got it to add the device but got stuck on ‚Äúsecurity check‚Äù and never finished. Now the microwave says it‚Äôs connected but app says offline. Tried resetting it, no joy. Now I can‚Äôt remove it or add it back. App won‚Äôt let me remove it from account. So even after resetting the microwave, it wouldn‚Äôt let me add it again because it said it was already associated with an account. It‚Äôs a complete mess and absolutely useless.

title: Fantastic!
text: My first experience with modern laundry appliances and enjoying the experience so far...thinking of my grandmother in Nebraska who told me stories as a kid using a washboard and wringer to wash clothes...and now appliances are Bluetooth and WiFi enabled...Amazing!

title: Pointless

So in short pointless unless you want to reopen the app to see the statues of the units. Notifications is  crucial and unfortunately doesn't work!

title: Not thrilled

I‚Äôve tried erasing and reinstalling the app and it continues to do the same thing. HELP!

title: Doesn‚Äôt work

Now it says my password is wrong. I double and triple checked - it isn‚Äôt wrong. I reset my password and tried again, three times, and it still says it‚Äôs wrong.

title: This app doesn‚Äôt work.
text:
Won‚Äôt let me login. Even tried resetting my password etc. it has never once let me log in

title: Crappy App

title: Miserable App won‚Äôt connect to Microwave
text: Not sure I‚Äôm going to bother to contact customer service as most comments say they are disinterested and surly.  Stupid app is stuck in a loop where it wants me to forget my WiFi settings and I forget them and I doesn‚Äôt fricken believe me! title: Smart features don‚Äôt work
text: I‚Äôm able to connect the oven with the app and my router. I‚Äôm able to turn the light on and off. The auto set date and time only works if I switch auto off and then back on again. title: Connected to WiFi, will only turn on oven light
text: Like many others, I‚Äôm having difficulty getting the app to work as advertised. I‚Äôm connected to the internet, and the phone communicates (it will turn the oven light on and off, and will start a timer) but will not set up the stove for a cooking cycle EVEN when the stove remote enabled.  The icon always indicates the stove is ‚Äúidle‚Äù even when it‚Äôs actually operating.

title: App doesn‚Äôt recognize range

Update - I also bought the smart dishwasher and amazingly enough it has the exact same issue. It connects to the WiFi just fine but the app never sees the appliance online to associate it with my account.

title: Problems with iPhone
text: This app works fine on my iPad but on my iPhone I cannot save preferences. When I change the push notifications and tap Save, the iPhone says it had problems updating appliance preferences and please try again. This happens every time I try.

title: Great oven, wasted money buying smart capability
text: This app is terrible. I set everything up, logged in and checked the box to stay logged in. Each time I open the app I have to re-enter my user name and password. I have had to reset the password a times to get it to work...why won‚Äôt it stay logged in? Why is there not an option for iPhone keychain to remember the password. Also, I can only turn on the oven light remotely, I cannot preheat the oven remotely.

title: Easy to use - connected with purpose
text: Thank you to whirlpool for my new connected suite of appliances in sunset bronze. Stylish with our new white cabinets, our friends love them and I‚Äôm about to start our dishwasher and laundry set from bed. Goodnight.

title: Worthless ‚Äúsmart‚Äù oven
text: We bought our brand new Smart oven over a year ago and the app has never functioned to turn it on. I have called tech support and they said the engineers were working on an update to fix the ‚Äúknow issue‚Äù. Well that was three months ago. Don‚Äôt waste your money on the smart oven because all you can do is turn the light on and off with your phone.

title: App is useless
text:
Recently bought the whirlpool smart oven. Installed, connected the oven to WiFi and connected the app. I can trigger the oven light and control lock. The remote control for the actual baking feature does not connect or send commands even with remote enabled on the oven itself. Also, there is no setting anywhere in the preferences with the ability to swap oven temp from Celsius to Fahrenheit on the app. 
Until the app is fixed, the whirlpool app is useless to me.

title: Missing notifications - Fixed!
text:
I just got a different phone. I downloaded the app and I was not getting any notifications.

I was able to fix my issue. I had to delete the product (washer and dryer) and reads them. Once I did that, everything was good to go. Notifications, and sounds.

title: Works great.....when it works
text: I love that I can be upstairs or out back and keep an eye on my oven. However, on numerous occasions my app and my oven don‚Äôt always talk to each other. I have tried signing out and then back in, turning WiFi off and then on...nothing happens. Then it starts working just as spontaneous as it stoped working.

title: Don‚Äôt update!
text: Do not update app. Everything worked perfect before update. Now I can‚Äôt get phone to connect to wall over. Crap!

title: Monthly fee!? Just stupid...
text:
When you‚Äôre paying thousands of dollars on an appliance you shouldn‚Äôt have to pay a monthly fee to unlock features that should be available upon install. Because you know, you‚Äôve paid thousands of dollars for it. 

Don‚Äôt give me that ‚Äú6 months free crap.‚Äù It‚Äôs not free. I paid for it and I should have to continue to pay for it. What a scam...

title: Can not register
text: Like others have said- app freezes on State selection while trying to register. Also first refrigerator broke 4 months from new. Took over a months worth of phone calls, repair men, and numerous (5) parts trying to figure out what was wrong before we had enough and we're going to contact our attorney before they sent us a new one. Horrible customer service to say the least.

title: All was well until...

Now I don‚Äôt ‚Äúneed‚Äù a connected microwave but it does offer some convenience. I don‚Äôt know what y‚Äôall did to make it stop connecting to WiFi but it‚Äôs broken and I‚Äôm not happy.

title: Notifications still don‚Äôt work
text: It‚Äôs been years since the notifications work... üò°üò°üò°.  The app works just fine and even shows what the washer and dryer are doing correctly... notifications are set correctly on my iPhone but no notification when cycle is done. So tired of this!

title: Wish we would have never purchased. Both the washer and dryer!!!
text:
WiFi on these is horrible. I own a network company, so I am well versed in this area. Hard to stay connected. 

Not like the old equipment from 20-30 years ago. WAY too much maintaining of equipment. I could go on, but when you‚Äôre service tech HIGHLY recommends purchasing the extended warranty. Buyer beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Still haven‚Äôt fixed the app yet?

Whirlpool, you need to up your game or offer a microwave w/o the ‚Äúsmart‚Äù feature for a lower price. Why should a consumer have to pay for features that don‚Äôt work?

title: Appliance won‚Äôt connect after power outage

After a simple 5 second power outage the microwave won‚Äôt come back online in the app.  The WiFi icon is displayed on the microwave, but the app shows the appliance as offline. No matter how many times i restart the app or try to rejoin, nothing works. I‚Äôm joined on the same WiFi network to type this review, so that‚Äôs not the issue.

title: Not so smart

title: The update stinks
text: I have a double oven that I use with this app. I want all oven features/ options in ONE place. I don‚Äôt want to have to go hunt for a simple thing like turning on the light. There‚Äôs also no way that I know of that I can turn OFF my oven from the app. It is slow, clunky and your U/I developers should be fired for allowing this abomination of an app lose on the world.

title: Remote features never work

title: WiFi?

title: It‚Äôs 2013 ‚ÄúSmart‚Äù

title: I expected much more
text: The app functions and connects to my convection microwave, but that‚Äôs as much good as I can say for it. It has some bugs, including that the scan-to-cook feature often reports the microwave is in use when it is not. The microwave status shows ‚Äúidle‚Äù and pressing scan-to-cook just pops up a message saying the appliance is running. I have to then actually use the appliance to heat something, and at the end of that cycle, scan-to-cook will work. But it really doesn‚Äôt matter because the scan-to-cook feature is nearly worthless anyway. I‚Äôve scanned the entire contents of my freezer and found only 2 items that were recognized. Major national brands like Green Giant, Banquet, Marie Calendar, and TGI Friday‚Äôs were not recognized. The same was true for major retailer‚Äôs house brands, like WalMart, Meier, and Kroger - none were recognized. But if all you have to heat are Boston Market or Lean Cuisine frozen entrees, those worked, so you‚Äôre all set. The next time I‚Äôm at the store, I‚Äôm going to scan the pizza bites that Whirlpool shows in the demo video for scan-to-cook to see if they actually work, and my bet is that they will not be recognized. The app lets you enter cooking instructions manually and save them as a favorite, but this is obviously meant for ovens rather than microwaves as only whole minute increments are allowed. How about allowing the app to save a barcode, name it, and manually enter the cooking instructions including seconds if the library of supported brands is going to be so small? Better still, an interactive feature allowing users to upload their scanned items and cooking instructions to grow your library would be great.

title: Remote enabled deactivates after 24 hours.
text: The biggest flaw with this app and the machines is that after 24 hours the remote enabled access automatically disconnects.I spoke with customer service and they advised that this is a safety feature that prevents appliances from being accidentally enabled when the owner is unaware. (I.e. an oven or dryer).While I understand the need for the safety feature I also feel that if this is going to be a selling point you need to be able to re-enable the remote access from your phone wherever you are and not have to be in front of the  machine. The whole point of remote enabled is to be able to remotely access and start your machines when you are not in front of them.The rep suggested I walk past my machine daily and reenable it each day which to me is just another step that I wasn‚Äôt looking for! The rep was super nice and helpful. At least I know It‚Äôs not something I was doing incorrectly. Please make it possible to Re-enable remote access remotely! Thank you.

title: Buyer beware!
text: Bought this appliance suite for my wife to make life easier. Haha, I should have known better. The software is proprietary and hardware used is dated and doesn‚Äôt integrate well even with the limited amazon support. The dryer, dishwasher, and microwave struggle to stay connected to WiFi. The whole point to make this technology useful is to save time. The Whirlpool app used is buggy and requires fumbling with to actually get it to operate, and this assumes you properly prepared the appliance by a required ‚Äúenable‚Äù button push each and every time. To me this is counter intuitive as the app and remote control function should free me from having to be standing in front of the appliance. We have implemented useful home automation features we have really enjoyed regrettably the Whirlpool appliance suite has been more of a pain than it has been worth. My recommendation would be for Whirlpool to pair with some leader(s) {don‚Äôt limit yourself to one} in the HA business to allow some real innovation in the convenience of use area. Also consider using some open source software there are some great communities of innovators with some great ideas to supplement and compliment the software and functionality!

title: Errors Errors and more Errors
text:
This application has never worked as advertised with the appliances. It took several months of trial and error just to connect the appliances to Wi-Fi. Lessons learned: you may need to use the WPS feature on your router to connect. Therefore the WPS feature on your router must be enabled through your router settings online. Secondly and even more technical, you may need to connect to your appliance IP through the Internet with a laptop or pc from your home network before you can connect via any mobile devices. Lastly it only works on 2.4 Wi-Fi. Your mobile device must be on the same channel. In summary Wi-Fi connection to your appliances using this app is far to technical and complicated for the average appliance owner. 

Only Minimal Wi-Fi features are functional. The application will not allow setting any of the appliance specific ‚Äúpreferences‚Äù without returning the error code ‚ÄúError updating appliance preferences. Please try again later‚Äù.... Later has come and gone over the past year. I have submitted several work orders with whirlpool that have only wasted my time without any resolution. Previous open tickets with Whirlpool tech support have been closed without resolving the issue. They did not attempt to contact me in regard to any of the open tickets they closed. 

Checking for software updates via this app will crash the application and you will need to force close the application. The software update seems to be unresponsive from the preferences menu. It just says loading for a few seconds and disappears without any update notices. When you go back one menu then the software update notice finally appears stating software is up to date. The ‚Äúdismiss notice‚Äù radio button does nothing and the application becomes unresponsive (crashes). You must then force close the application and log back in. 

The Whirlpool tech support frequently fails to correctly identify these issues. So there can simply be no resolve if the issue is not accurately identified. I get an overwhelming perception that Whirlpool tech support Representatives simply don‚Äôt care. This has been the case for several help tickets. Today I spoke with a Whirlpool representative again who failed to listen and continuously spoke over me with erroneous feedback and unskilled understanding of the problem. He eventually initiated an argument with me until I demanded to speak with a lead. The lead however was receptive and effectively documented the problem. 

These Wi-Fi appliances along with this application were chosen to improve the quality of life for a disabled Veteran with traumatic head injuries. He needs the advantages of Wi-Fi augmented devices to cook and clean however this defective application and the inability of Whirlpool to effectively and efficiently resolve systemic technical problems has become a real nightmare for this Veteran who has invested his savings of $6,000 on worthless mobile application enabled appliances. 

I would strongly advise looking elsewhere for applications and supported Wi-Fi enabled devices. Whirlpool Corp is clearly lagging far behind in this age of technology in that regard.

title: Not a Good App

title: Still crap
text:
So after getting the board in my oven replaced (since it was defective from the factory) I tried connecting to WiFi but no networks would show up until I manually searched by SSID, failed, and then saw a list of local networks. 
I was able to scan the code in this app, eventually connect to WiFi, and then the oven said the app and oven were finally connected. Great. I go back to my app and unfortunately my app disagreed with my oven and still showed no devices. Ok I‚Äôll just scan the code again:
 - oh wait, I already connected to WiFi so the code is now hidden. Great choice there app developers üëç. I guess I‚Äôll just type in a bunch of digits inconveniently. Ok I typed in the SAID (and MAC which it doesn‚Äôt tel you to explicitly put in but leaves you to figure that out on your own). Now the oven will connect, right?  Ha, good one. Now I have to spend the rest of my day figuring out why it still won‚Äôt connect. Well I know why, this whole thing was designed by idiots, but I have to now waste more of my time seeing if I can get lucky enough to connect them. title: Doesn‚Äôt Work With NETGEAR Orbi System
text:
12/12/18 Update:

Via another support session with Whirlpool‚Äôs IoT support staff, I can now report a successful connection between the microwave and the app. I was told their engineers changed some things on the back end.

I would still insist that the setup requirement that both the phone and appliance are on the same 2.4GHz network is absurd. Many new routers support both bands, and there‚Äôs no way to tell an iPhone ‚Äú...connect only to 2.4GHz WiFi...‚Äù I get it that the appliance is limited to using only 2.4GHz WiFi, but it shouldn‚Äôt matter what frequency band the iPhone is using, as long as they are both on the same network.

Developers should look at the setup process for a TP-Link Kasa smart WiFi plug. I set one up yesterday with the smart plug on the 2.4GHz band and my phone on the 5GHz band, and the setup process was quick and painless.

All the above being said, I‚Äôm revising my rating of this app from 1 star to 2.

We are now at the 6 month point since I first tried to connect our microwave, and several sessions with Whirlpool‚Äôs IoT support team have failed to resolve the issue.

Our Orbi system provides WiFi over 2 frequencies, 2.4GHz and 5GHz, acting as one network with one SSID. The setup calls for both the mobile device and microwave to be on the same 2.4GHz network. 

I don‚Äôt know if this is true with Android phones or not, but it isn‚Äôt possible in iOS to select a specific frequency band...my iPhone will always connect to the 5GHz band.

So that‚Äôs a problem right away!

Help from NETGEAR showed me how to temporarily turn off the 5GHz band, and I tried this during one of the support sessions with Whirlpool, but I‚Äôm still not able to connect the phone to the microwave ‚Äòs network.

So I‚Äôm stuck with an appliance that connects to my WiFi just fine, but won‚Äôt connect to my phone....rendering the WiFi connection completely useless.

Buyer beware.

title: Had to replace oven
text:
I would have given less than one star if it were possible.  This software did not work. It damaged the oven beyond repair, so we had to replace it.  My recommendation is to not use the software.  It is possibly safer to just use the manual controls.

Update 12/02/18:

We got a new oven from Whirlpool.  The oven works, but I have given up using the app.  The app is poorly made, it is counter intuitive.  I certainly do not trust the app to control the function of the oven.  Further, the oven is continuously disconnecting itself from the WiFi.  This seem to be the first generation of ‚Äúsmart‚Äù appliances.  My recommendation is to stay away from ‚Äúsmart‚Äù appliances till they are more reliable.

title: App won‚Äôt work at all
text: I just spent over $4,000 at Best Buy getting all new appliances for my home. A new Whirlpool dishwasher, oven, microwave and fridge. Excited to use the wireless technology as an IT manager myself, I downloaded the app and immediately created an account. After doing so it prompted me to verify my email. Peculiar enough however, it had my name and email listed as null. After not receiving an email, I tried the ‚Äúresend email‚Äù option only to realize it was sending to (null). So clearly my information was not saved to their database correctly. Unfortunately the app will not let me do absolutely anything to resolve the situation. I‚Äôve reached out to support but they insulting asked if I ‚Äúchecked my email to see if I got the verification email‚Äù.  An absolute joke considering I explained my entire situation in detail along with all of my troubleshooting steps. At this point I‚Äôve reached out to support two additional times with no response. I am completely and utterly flabbergasted at how bad this app is and how worse the support is.

title: Very poorly done

BTW - it‚Äôs easier to just enter the SAID number & Mac ID than to find the qr code to scan.

title: Oven Does Not Connect To App
text:
I went through every connection method available (scan the QR code, find network manually, use WPS to connect) and my app simply won‚Äôt connect to the oven. I called customer service, and after 2 hours of them having me do everything I did on my own, they told me they see my appliance connected to my router but couldn‚Äôt do anything for me. I let them know that I‚Äôve connected several appliances to my network from other brands with no issue. I asked what the next steps were for fixing the problem and was told it would take engineering about a week to get back to me with no promise of resolution. I had one more day to bring the oven back to my appliance dealer, so I opted to do that and bought another brand (which connected first try) instead.

The Devleoper‚Äôs Response is to ALL reviews is to call Customer Care. I did this, and all they can do is say they‚Äôre sorry, but it‚Äôs out of their hands- only engineering can handle it, and they will not transfer you to anyone who is useful. Awful company.
